org.logevents.util.pattern

Class PatternConverterSpec<T extends java.util.function.Function<?,java.lang.String>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.logevents.util.pattern.PatternConverterSpec<T>

  • public class PatternConverterSpec<T extends java.util.function.Function<?,java.lang.String>>
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to parse a single conversion for PatternLogEventFormatter. A conversion is on the format "%[<minlength>][.<maxlength>]<conversion word>[(<conversion subpattern>)][{<parameter>,<parameter>}]".
    Author:
    Johannes Brodwall

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

    • Method Detail

      • readConversion

        public void readConversion(PatternReader<T> formatter)
        Reads all the internal state from the scanner. Can only be called once as it doesn't rewind the scanner.
        Parameters:
        formatter - Used for sub-patterns

      • readConversion

        public void readConversion()

      • getMinLength

        public java.util.Optional<java.lang.Integer> getMinLength()
        If the resulting string is shorter than abs(min)-length, it should be padded. If minLength is negative, the string should be right-padded, otherwise, it should be left padded. If minLength is Optional.empty(), output will not be padded.

      • getMaxLength

        public java.util.Optional<java.lang.Integer> getMaxLength()
        If the resulting string is longer than abs(min)-length, it should be truncated. If maxLength is negative, the string should be truncated on the right, otherwise, it should be truncated on the left. If maxLength is Optional.empty(), output will not be truncated.

      • getConversionWord

        public java.lang.String getConversionWord()
        The function represented is represented by the conversion word. The full list of conversion words are given in PatternLogEventFormatter.getConversionWords()

      • getSubpattern

        public java.util.Optional<T> getSubpattern()
        A fully parsed sub pattern specified in parenthesis () after the conversion word. The string used in the subpattern can contain further conversions of its own.

      • getParameters

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getParameters()
        A list of parameters specified in curly brackets after the conversion word. The parameters are separated by , and can optionally by quoted with single quotes ('). For example %date{ 'HH:mm:ss,SSS', Europe/Oslo} has the parameters "HH:mm:ss,SSS" and "Europe/Oslo"

      • getParameter

        public java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> getParameter(int i)

      • getIntParameter

        public java.util.Optional<java.lang.Integer> getIntParameter(int i)

      • getThrowableFormatter

        public java.util.function.BiFunction<java.lang.Throwable,java.util.Optional<java.lang.Integer>,java.lang.String> getThrowableFormatter()

      • getConfiguration

        public Configuration getConfiguration()
